meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I nould go to the park with my friends.
meanings.sent2: She nould finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: The cat nould chase its tail, but it was too tired.
meanings.sent4: His determination nould him to succeed against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The wind nould the leaves off the trees in a swirling dance.

meanings.definition: Nould (noun): a small hill or mound
meanings.sent1: The children played on the nould at the edge of the field.
meanings.sent2: The sheep grazed peacefully on the grassy nould.
meanings.sent3: The nould provided a perfect spot for a picnic with a view.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the nould, casting a warm glow over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The birds perched on the nould, chirping happily in the morning.

meanings.definition: Nould (adjective): not willing or inclined to do something
meanings.sent1: He was nould to help with the chores, preferring to play outside.
meanings.sent2: The cat seemed nould to come out from under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn donkey was nould to move from its spot.
meanings.sent4: Her nould attitude made it difficult to work together on the project.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds had a nould appearance, hinting at an impending storm.
